attributes.action: change the law and extend the current Armed Forces Compensation scheme to cover all those injured in the War on Terror.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to  change the law and extend existing Armed Forces Compensation Scheme arrangements to include troops seriously injured in Afghanistan and Iraq between the start of the war on terror in 2001 and the introduction of proper arrangements in 2005, so that all those seriously wounded in the ‘War on Terror’ are treated equally. At present the Armed Forces Compensation Scheme explicitly excludes those wounded in the first four years of the ‘War on Terror’. Fairness dictates that, given the sacrifices made by British troops in service of our country in Afghanistan and Iraq, each soldier seriously injured in these theatres should benefit from the same compensation arrangements, enabling them a decent on-going quality of life. We call upon the Government to make this happen and to recognise the sacrifices made by all of those seriously injured in combat in Afghanistan and Iraq.
